headline: 'The Five' on crime, Biden vaccine mandate revolt

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Judge Jeannine Pirro, Jessica Tarlov, Dana Perino and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is THE FIVE. The Biden White House coming to the sudden realization that crime is bad after blaming the wave of violence on the pandemic. The administration now trying to distance itself from outrageous comments from far left Democrats like AOC and Chicago's mayor Lori Lightfoot. They were downplaying the smash and grab rampages.

utterances.speaker: LORI LIGHTFOOT, MAYOR OF CHICAGO
utterances.sentences: I'm disappointed that they are not doing more to take safety and make it a priority. For example, we still have retailers that won't institute plans like having security officers in their store.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ (D-NY)
utterances.sentences: We're actually seeing a lot of these allegations of organized retail theft are not actually panning out like these, I believe it's Walgreens in California cited it, but the data didn't back it up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Apparently, it's Democrats spewing that nonsense for the White House to finally condemn it.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: We don't agree. We have seen some of these extremely video -- extremely disturbing videos showing retail theft and both major retailers as well as state and local leaders like Governor Newsom have identified this is a serious concern. We agree. That's the reason why we have sent additional support from the FBI providing additional assistance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: While some liberal prosecutors claim the crime surge isn't real, 12 major cities are setting homicide records. And the crime crisis hitting close to home. Fox News is rebuilding our all-American Christmas tree after and arsonists set it on fire. Police and firefighters responding quickly and thankfully no one was hurt. All right, Greg, no one likes the tree more than you did. How do you feel?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know. It's a terrific loss in my life. Actually, it is -- it's pretty horrible. The tree is basically represent the kind of random violence that is fueled by mental illness that has become pretty much part of everyday city life. We have abandoned the deranged and I use the deranged as a scientific term. There are criminally deranged people living on our streets and we're merely -- we're part of some weird experiment where progressives had never really thought about what happens when you allow unstable and dangerous people into the general public. Well, they assault women. We've seen that. They assault elderly women. We've seen that. We've seen them assault elderly Asian women. Remember? That was -- that used to be a hate crime, right? Is it still a hate crime because we don't hear about it? There's lots of property damage and now you see a tree getting burned down. A lot of this crime, we know what's causing it. We don't know how to deal with this problem anymore. And it has to do with a change in language using the umbrella term of homeless which consists of a lot of factions, but we immediately are told to assume its people down on their luck, but it is not just that. You have grifters. You have junkies. You have the mentally ill. You have the criminally deranged. We were sold the idea that the homeless were benign families who miss one month of rent. No. You walk up and down the streets of New York, you see the consequences of Mayor de Blasio's utter failure in dealing with the mentally ill. We gave his wife a billion bucks to deal with this. We have no idea where the money went. Meanwhile, innocent civilians, tourists, people in Times Square in broad daylight are getting there asses kicked. They're getting bludgeoned. They're getting murdered by people who do not belong on the street. And we want to get them off of the streets because they are a danger to themselves as well. But we have a grotesque, the ghoulish mayor who doesn't give a flying F. So there is only one solution for this and that is people have to start suing the cities that release thugs and the mentally ill onto the street who brutalize people. You know, there is a guy that just beat two women in New York and he was released. Then he went and beat another woman savagely at -- like 9:00 a.m. on a Sunday. And then he was let out again. And these are the courts. We don't have guns in New York. We can't protect ourselves. The cops only arrive after the crime. The only thing that's left is to go after the courts to sue the cities. And whether it's a class action suit, but this stuff has to stop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do you think that would be effective if people started just slapping lawsuits on this municipalities, judge?

utterances.speaker: JEANNINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: You know, it depends. A lot of people are covered by sovereign immunity, but here is the problem. It all lies in the legislature. This whole issue has to do with the revolving door of justice. Whether it be the revolving door of justice as it relates to criminals or the revolving doors that relates to mental illness. And what -- we don't know that this guy was mentally ill. Everybody wants to say, oh, they're mentally ill, they're crazy. I think they're evil, okay. There's a big difference. But, he's got two prior public intoxication -- two prior drug arrest and one public intoxication. There is nothing that indicates he's necessarily mentally ill. Maybe he's off his rocker. I wouldn't climb up that tree, but you know, that's just me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You got the legs for it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Got the -- no, not anymore. But here's the problem, the problem is that we are left to live with those who are dangerous to us and to the community.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: As a judge, my power always stems from the ability to take someone out of society who I thought was a danger to himself or others. It's called the 730 in New York. Then you can send in the Bellevue and then they can sit there for a while and be analyzed. But the bottom line here is the left is lying to us that's why this is happening. When Lori Lightfoot comes out and she says there is no crime here and it's up to the people who own the stores. You're full of crap. The people who own the stores pay taxes and you're defunding the police. You're telling the police to stand down. It's you, Lori Lightfoot. And I'm sick and tired of people talking about the fact that you know what, we've got to worry about these people. No, I want to worry about the innocent victims. And Larry Krasner ought to be beaten out of Philadelphia, booted out of Philadelphia I should say and recall along with Gascon. They are literally killing us and injuring us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How do you feel about all this, Dana?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: I mean, I will concur with everything. I am baffled by the effort to downplay the rising rate of crime and murder across the country by the federal government, by the administration. I understand that the press secretary today said, well, actually, the DOJ is helping a little bit. Like I just think that's pretty weak sauce compare to what people are seeing. When you had one of the police officers today, when the stats came out about the 12 cities, he said that it was up in Rochester. That this is like a war zone. People are actually seeing this with their own eyes and I think we need a surge to deal with it. I think that a lot of this money that they want to spend in Build Back Better should be put into our prison system, into the court system. If the courts are backed up or the prisons are backed up where you don't have enough prison guards, you don't have enough police, that' where I would put all of that money, maybe not all, okay. But I would put a great majority of it there because if people do not feel safe, they're -- people are not going to vote for you if you tell them, you're fine, you're fine. No, don't worry. This is -- murder capital, don't worry about it. War zone, it's not real. That's what Larry Krasner did in Philadelphia.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: People are not going to vote for them. People are going to vote for people who say I'll keep you safe. And who's saying that right now?

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I am saying it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're conservative now that you're pregnant.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes, for one more week.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did you read "The New York Times" headline, though, about this trade tree? They said it just caught on fire?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It just caught on fire.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, that SUV also just plowed through a Christmas parade.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. Well, yes, you're really coming around.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I just read a lot and it was in "The New York Times" so, as it was in my bible. So, Eric Adams is saying I'm going to keep safe. And there are some mayors across the country and specifically the police chief, so I think, are leading this surge of making it clear to people and even higher positions of power that what's going on on the ground is not adequate. They don't have the support that they need. They don't have enough police officers who have stayed in their jobs or who want to answer these calls because they know that things are not going to turn out as well for them as they did before and we can debate how we got to this place. But I think it relates to the conversation from last week about when we're going to see the fissures between the D.A.' and the council members and the police officer, the police chief and now the administration. And I do believe that Joe Biden gets this. This is how he talked on the campaign trail. He was the first one to come out about the looting and to say this is different than the George Floyd protest. This is ransacking stores and just taking what you want. So, I'm hopeful that we will shift more on that direction. And as always, because this is on film, that is why this is happening. Like this is why people are going to jail who would might normally be able to get away with it and it's what's going on with these stores because you can't say they're not being looted because it's all on film.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but who's going to jail?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Like Derek Chauvin -- I'm saying that we've had a lot of --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, with murders, yes. But he violent crime that affects all of us.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I'm just saying that the phenomenon of being able to record everything is making a substance difference in people's ability to ignore - -

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's not about 20 years. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, from the reporting, the guy that lit the tree on fire is probably going to get out today or tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: He's going to make bail. Arson --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because it's not a felony arson for what he did apparently.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, it's an offense under New York law where he has to be bailed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay. Forget about whether or not he is tied to the community. The guy is homeless. He has no ties.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So how does he do bail if he doesn't have any money?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't need money anymore.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, you don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You can walk out the door?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's why they have this bail reform.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No cash bail.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No cash bail.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It's a euphemism.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Hopefully, they take away his lighter.

utterances.speaker: GURFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Coming up, Joe Biden now ordering the corrupt liberal media to save his presidency.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: President Biden now trying to pressure the media into giving him better coverage. The White House is not happy with how the press has been talking about inflation and the supply crisis. So a group of senior officials are reportedly holding secret meetings with major outlets and are trying to convince them into or coerce them I should say, into more positive coverage. And it looks like "The View" got the message loud and clear.

utterances.speaker: WHOOPI GOLDBERG, HOST OF THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: The question is why don't people want to hear the good news for a change, you know? Is that what we need to hear when something good is happening here?

utterances.speaker: JOY BEHAR, HOST OF THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: You said, you know, that people are not picking up on the good stuff. I believe that that's because the media is not portraying him as a winner. They are minimizing what he is doing. When the chips are down, Americans are going to understand that if Republicans take control of this country again, we are done as a country. We are done! Believe it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And they actually applaud. What do you say, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's an enlightened crowd.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Though you might want to go on that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I know. For the next book, yes, we might have to do "The View." Do you realize how bad things must be for a Democrat president to be begging Democrats in the media for a better spin?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Haven't they done enough, judge? I mean, they spiked the laptop. They ignored the border. They cheerlead all of his mandates. They write stories like why inflation is actually a good thing.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, like, what else could they do? It's like me telling Johnny like, Johnny, you have to do more. You're really not doing enough. Like, what else could johnny do? Breastfeed Jesse, Jr.? Honestly. I mean, if he could I'd ask for it. But the thing that's going on here is this, Biden has some nerve to ask the press. He hasn't talked to the press. He turns around like he's deaf every time he's finished talking.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's fair. That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's done two sit down interviews since May. Last time I checked its December. What does he do? He clowns around to the town hall with Lemon or Cooper the whole time. He hasn't even sat down with the AP, Reuters, "Washington Post," "New York Times," "Wall Street Journal." And then he complains about bad coverage? He's not selling his agenda because he's a poor communicator. And so --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- his team is going to all the journalist and saying "can you be a little bit more like Jen Psaki?" Try to be a little bit more like Jen. And if he had good results, those results would sell themselves. If he was reducing crime, inflation, illegal immigration, COVID cases, he'd get better coverage.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But the point is they are saying -- they are saying he is not communicating properly. Is he not communicating properly or is Jesse right that he has limited the number of interviews and is continuing his campaign bunker strategy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I actually imagine that if I were those report -- those newsrooms that got one of these visits, I would say, excuse me? Because we haven't heard from him. We haven't even talked to him. Like we can ask Jen Psaki questions, she's the press secretary. She's very available and she answers all the questions. We might not like the answers but that's what they are. He doesn't do -- he's not selling it. And they -- I read these headlines, Biden's communicators are to blame. No, they are not. And also they miss opportunities all the time. It comes from the top. For example, the other day they could have had a great press conference that said, guess what, omicron not as lethal as we thought.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That was great. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, this is great news. And in fact, guess what, you're not going to have to wear a mask on a plane. Something like that. Like they could make decisions based on science, actually. That would help them. But this is the same White House that demanded better coverage for the amazing airlift they did out of Afghanistan. It was like people were falling off the planes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is the White House that said that Republicans were the ones who wanted to defund the police. They had to backtrack on that. They said that inflation wasn't happening. Then they said, well, it's just transitory, when people are basically seeing in their own lives, but also in the statistics that come out. So, I got to hand it to them, like to go in, like they know that they have a problem so that they're going to go in. I don't think that it's going to change "The View" saying we should all be happy and celebrate the wins. It's not going to change the fact that when you're at the grocery store and you see somebody in front of you that basically is like counting up the items and having to put away the Rice Krispies treat ingredients. And I heard this from a Democrat on the "Against the Grain Podcast.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Like that stuff is real.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, it is real, but Greg, what about the allegation that the press is underselling the good news? What is the good news?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's hilarious. I mean, this reminds me of a guy going to another guy and pleading with them to talk him up in front of a girl he likes, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who hasn't done that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. I do that, you know, when I talked to the CEO at Fox about Jesse. Jesse's really coming along. But you got to be in total, I mean, think about it when "The View" becomes your public relations arm.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, I guess the cast from "Teen Mom" was busy because I mean, this is -- I mean, it's amazing how almost like robotic that was. But I love also how this is posed as a secret meeting behind the scenes as if --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- it acknowledges the fact that the Biden White House is indeed a facade like a storefront from an episode of "Gunsmoke" and you just, right behind -- that's just fake.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's all this other stuff going on and they don't know what the hell is going on. I just long for the good old days when Trump would just - - Trump didn't do -- Trump would talk to anybody and everybody. You know exactly what he was thinking. And he, of course, he did call. The only people he called in the news were commentariats, right? He never like went to the heart. They didn't call up anybody. He didn't call up Bret Baier. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You'd be surprised. I think he called everybody.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. I think he called everyone including Maggie Haberman.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But everything he said on the phone he would say on T.V.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Joe doesn't talk to anybody except for himself when he's muttering in the yard.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. All right, Jessica. Now, think about it. The White House has three other senior officials trying to talk to the press. And the one that I thought was most interesting to persuade the press to give better coverage was the ports envoy. Yes, I guess he's going to tell him the supply chain problem is isn't as bad as we think it is.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, ports are top of mind for people.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Because --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So what's the good news?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Well, the good news actually, I thought this was interesting. Today, Joe Manchin put out this -- he carries around a card of the administration's accomplishments. Joe Manchin who I find to be relentlessly negative actually in terms of Democratic causes, actually walked around with this and talks about the COVID Relief Act, talks of the bipartisan Infrastructure Act.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: People need money and they like money and Republicans love money more than Democrats do so that should be a good thing. But --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, no. This money is going, well, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: They clearly know there is a problem and there were two things today that struck my interest on this front. One, Joe Manchin carries around this card, and two, the Monmouth Poll that showed that inflation and kitchen table issues are top of mind for basically every voter no matter your partisan affiliation. And that's what they are having to run against. And having a ports envoy have this conversation or people who aren't Joe Biden who I think does actually pretty well in these interviews, is not going to hack it for the American public. And so that needs to switch around before the midterms come around. And people want to see their president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We need an envoy. Let me see this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay. Ahead, Democrats are now turning fast on Biden's vaccine mandates.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Democrats beginning to sour on President Biden's vaccine mandates. Senator Joe Manchin now coming out against them and prominent liberals like Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer is upset that with the impact they've had on private businesses and the workforce. So, Dana, I'm going to go to you on this. It's obviously a big turn on the tide here. What do you think the Biden administration is going to do?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, just like -- let's go back to August in Afghanistan for just a moment. And I believe it was middle of the month now, Afghanistan has been going downhill for two weeks and we're watching all of this happen. And all of a sudden, there's a press conference as announced by President Biden. Oh, what's it -- talk about Afghanistan? All right, pay attention. No. That's when he announced all these vaccine mandates to try to change the subject. And I think that he completely miscalculated. I understand wanting to get people vaccinated, absolutely. And I support vaccines for the people that it make sense for health-wise. But Rand Paul did something pretty interesting through the Small Business Committee showing like -- showing how the job impact in different states is the result of these vaccine mandates. So, if when you look at it that way, you have the president saying "well, we're going to do these mandates." Well, the Republicans are going to say something and it was going to be job impact. So, in some ways, this decision in the middle of Afghanistan to just throw out there the vaccine mandate without good legal backing was the most costly P.R. stunt in history because now it's going to be pulled back.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Judge, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I think the judge who made the decision on pulling back all of the mandates was absolutely right, whether it's for companies with over 100 people, whether it's for the health care providers and now for the contractors, the federal contractors. Then I think -- and I'm going to read this. Even in times of crisis, courts must preserve the rule of law and ensure that all branches of government act within the bounds of their constitutionally grounded authority. Biden didn't do it that's why he keeps getting slapped down. And I -- one more thing, why is the left so focused on totalitarianism? They have such an instinct to lock us down, shut us down, and shut us up. That's all.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: We're tight on time so I'm just going to say, Jesse, but I disagree with all (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, yes. Not one, not two but all three of his vax mandates got rocked by the court. I remember someone sat right there in a mustache and they told me these vax mandates were perfectly legal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I remember hearing a lot about that. And now Biden's delayed his own federal government vax mandates until after Christmas. So he's going to fire you after the holidays instead of before the holidays, which is great. We were said, you know, you're vaxxed if you have your two shots. Now you're vaxxed if you have a booster. Now you have to get your five-year-old vaxxed. You're going to have to get your dog vaccine. Look, he's going to get the Pfizer by the way. And you don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Give him what the best.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- you can't have flex -- you have to have flexibility. You have to have some sort of religious exemption, medical exemption or else it feels too heavy-handed. And at this point, Joe blames all of his problems on COVID and he's just trying to vax his way out. And he can't do it because you're never going to get 100 percent vaccination rate in this country. So, he just has to get that through his head.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: If he can.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I got really nervous that Jesse thought I had a moustache, by the way, for a second there. Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you want a mustache, Jessica, you can have a mustache. This is 2021.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I don't. I don't want it. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay. Well, anyway, this is a dream come true for communists, right. The ever present -- ever present variant lets the government into your life more and more and to control it. And whenever one goes away, they can pop up another one. And suddenly, they like the police because the police have no control over what they decide. So the police has to end up enforcing these rules. And it can only go in dark places, Mayor Driftwood Easer Island face. This is my question to you. He's pushing -- he's pushing mandates as he leaves the office -- as he leaves office. In five days, the mandate -- the mandates come in and then he leaves. My question to you is what is he trying to gain out of this? This -- is there something here financially that De Blasio has like a connection with pharmacy -- pharmaceutical companies? Because I don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that he wants to be governor of New York and he needs to win a primary, so he's trying to get to the left of the current governor Kathy Hochul, and that this was the way to do it on his way out. That's what I think.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: I think he also doesn't like Eric Adams, so he wants him to have to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a political financial move in my mind. By the way, just one last thing, I don't understand why people don't understand that you can be vaxxed and against vax mandates.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm double vaxxed, I'm going to get a booster, I'm against vax mandates. People go like, you're vaxxed? And then they go, oh you're against -- like, you -- people live in this polarizing universe. They got to stop.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: All right, ahead, a verdict at any moment in the Jussie Smollett trial. The latest details coming up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.sentences: We look forward to meeting this baby. She's due in a week. It could be before.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. Give me that sandwich. I'll take that for a moment.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Jessica and Brian, congratulations from everyone here.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Thank you, guys.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Amazing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, before we get to "ONE MORE THING," I have a very special announcement to make. After our All-American Christmas Tree was set on fire by an arsonist this morning, we have planned for a new tree to be rebuilt and installed right outside here on Fox square. As a sign of resilience and hope we will be lighting the new light -- tree live here tomorrow night during THE FIVE and we will be joined by our colleagues Lawrence Jones and Abby Hornacek. They led the original tree lighting last weekend with Steve Doocy, Ainsley Earhart, Mike Rowe, Pete Hegseth, Rachel Campos-Duffy, Todd Piro, and Carly Shimkus Carley Shimkus. We also have some incredible guests including members of the FDNY and NYPD and remarks by Cardinal Dolan, our contributor Reverend Jacques DeGraff, and Rabbi Joseph Potosnick. The festivities start at 4 30 and we encourage all of you to come and enjoy some holiday cheer. And as a silver lining and an act of kindness during the holiday season, both Fox News Media and Fox Corporation have made a $100,000 donation to answer the call which provides financial assistance to the families of fallen service members of the FDNY and NYPD, the two agencies who responded immediately to our very own emergency. We are so grateful for all of them. And we would also like to take this opportunity to thank everyone for the outpouring of support from our neighbors around midtown Manhattan as well as our colleagues throughout Fox Corp and news corp and loyal viewers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And our very own Greg Gutfeld has announced that he's going to be matching all donations to that front.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow, amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Greg. You're very charitable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We'll be matching it in money.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you mean matching it --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And frosting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And frosting?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, all right, well, thank you for your kindness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you for your service.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's my apology tour.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh no. What did you do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: These are becoming more frequent, unfortunately. Yesterday, I said this on the show. Run it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And if that guy dies, the dog won't eat him. But the cat will eat his face right off.

utterances.speaker: TYRUS, FOX NEWS CHANNEL HOST
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, that is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Animals are great except cats.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, I offended a lot of cat people and I've heard from a lot of cat people. I didn't know how many cat people there were. So, I just want to say I'm sorry to the cats and the cat owners. I did not mean offense.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did not think that's what you'd be apologizing for.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's so many other things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There was -- there are a few.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, let's do this. Greg's Workout Tips. You know, as you know, when you work out at a gym as much as I do, it's important to be able to handle your free weights, use the right form, and above all, don't be bouncing the weights because you think it's cool, like this fellow here who's trying to do dead lifts. But he just like he's got -- its form is rough. He's throwing it down. There are people around in the gym that are just -- don't need to hear that. Really -- that's all I got to say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Get his father.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's going to hurt his back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's going to hurt his back, definitely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But don't you hate it when uninvited aunts and uncles decide that they want to come and see you? You know, they're always at your doorstep around the holidays. So, one Colorado family got the shock of a lifetime when this visitor appeared at the door. Take a look. OK, that's right. A massive elk use its antler to ring the front door bell. But he didn't stop there. Since no one came to the door, the elk decided to treat himself to a quick snack. He spent several minutes munching on the flowers near the door. After having his fill of flowers, he moved on to nibbling around the Christmas tree reef.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, it wasn't an aunt, it was an antler.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Antler.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, you are so clever.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You didn't even know that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I did. I put it in your head.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That went right over my head.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Me too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Jessica.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: The antler thing. OK, so let's do this. This is my first time being able to do this. Jessica's Christmas Sweater News. Also, that picture -- headshot, when I was thin, which is so nice to look at. I'll get back there one day. So, take a look at the world's most expensive Christmas sweater coming in at 34 000.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: The artist is Aidan Liban, from West London, post a reindeer on a starring night 24 karat gold thread, 2,000 Swarovski crystals, and lining made from Italian silk, 150 diamonds in the collar.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Diamonds?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes. You like it now? You like it better?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: And then we have at the Natural History Museum in London, I have another sweater to show you. Outfitted its animatronic Tyrannosaurus Rex in a colorful Christmas sweater, the turtleneck created by a British company that also dresses members of parliament. Do with that what you will. It fit snugly around the T-Rex's upper wide -- upper body and neck, and then tapered into little sleeves because they have the tiniest arms. That was the big challenge.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Those tiny arms.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: Yes. Like, we -- well, it's a bit --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's like when the -- that's like when the check comes. Like, it can't --

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.sentences: You just can't make it to my --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What killed the dinosaurs by the way? Have we ever figured that out?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Asteroids, man.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is it an asteroid?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Smoking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Smoking? Dana, now I know that's not true. That's it for us. "SPECIAL REPORT" is up next. Hey, Bret. Content and Programming Copyright 2021 Fox News Network, LLC. utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Judge Jeannine Pirro, Jessica Tarlov, Dana Perino and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is THE FIVE. The Biden White House coming to the sudden realization that crime is bad after blaming the wave of violence on the pandemic. The administration now trying to distance itself from outrageous comments from far left Democrats like AOC and Chicago's mayor Lori Lightfoot. They were downplaying the smash and grab rampages.

utterances.speaker: LORI LIGHTFOOT, MAYOR OF CHICAGO
utterances.utterance: I'm disappointed that they are not doing more to take safety and make it a priority. For example, we still have retailers that won't institute plans like having security officers in their store.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ (D-NY)
utterances.utterance: We're actually seeing a lot of these allegations of organized retail theft are not actually panning out like these, I believe it's Walgreens in California cited it, but the data didn't back it up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Apparently, it's Democrats spewing that nonsense for the White House to finally condemn it.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: We don't agree. We have seen some of these extremely video -- extremely disturbing videos showing retail theft and both major retailers as well as state and local leaders like Governor Newsom have identified this is a serious concern. We agree. That's the reason why we have sent additional support from the FBI providing additional assistance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: While some liberal prosecutors claim the crime surge isn't real, 12 major cities are setting homicide records. And the crime crisis hitting close to home. Fox News is rebuilding our all-American Christmas tree after and arsonists set it on fire. Police and firefighters responding quickly and thankfully no one was hurt. All right, Greg, no one likes the tree more than you did. How do you feel?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes, I know. It's a terrific loss in my life. Actually, it is -- it's pretty horrible. The tree is basically represent the kind of random violence that is fueled by mental illness that has become pretty much part of everyday city life. We have abandoned the deranged and I use the deranged as a scientific term. There are criminally deranged people living on our streets and we're merely -- we're part of some weird experiment where progressives had never really thought about what happens when you allow unstable and dangerous people into the general public. Well, they assault women. We've seen that. They assault elderly women. We've seen that. We've seen them assault elderly Asian women. Remember? That was -- that used to be a hate crime, right? Is it still a hate crime because we don't hear about it? There's lots of property damage and now you see a tree getting burned down. A lot of this crime, we know what's causing it. We don't know how to deal with this problem anymore. And it has to do with a change in language using the umbrella term of homeless which consists of a lot of factions, but we immediately are told to assume its people down on their luck, but it is not just that. You have grifters. You have junkies. You have the mentally ill. You have the criminally deranged. We were sold the idea that the homeless were benign families who miss one month of rent. No. You walk up and down the streets of New York, you see the consequences of Mayor de Blasio's utter failure in dealing with the mentally ill. We gave his wife a billion bucks to deal with this. We have no idea where the money went. Meanwhile, innocent civilians, tourists, people in Times Square in broad daylight are getting there asses kicked. They're getting bludgeoned. They're getting murdered by people who do not belong on the street. And we want to get them off of the streets because they are a danger to themselves as well. But we have a grotesque, the ghoulish mayor who doesn't give a flying F. So there is only one solution for this and that is people have to start suing the cities that release thugs and the mentally ill onto the street who brutalize people. You know, there is a guy that just beat two women in New York and he was released. Then he went and beat another woman savagely at -- like 9:00 a.m. on a Sunday. And then he was let out again. And these are the courts. We don't have guns in New York. We can't protect ourselves. The cops only arrive after the crime. The only thing that's left is to go after the courts to sue the cities. And whether it's a class action suit, but this stuff has to stop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think that would be effective if people started just slapping lawsuits on this municipalities, judge?

utterances.speaker: JEANNINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: You know, it depends. A lot of people are covered by sovereign immunity, but here is the problem. It all lies in the legislature. This whole issue has to do with the revolving door of justice. Whether it be the revolving door of justice as it relates to criminals or the revolving doors that relates to mental illness. And what -- we don't know that this guy was mentally ill. Everybody wants to say, oh, they're mentally ill, they're crazy. I think they're evil, okay. There's a big difference. But, he's got two prior public intoxication -- two prior drug arrest and one public intoxication. There is nothing that indicates he's necessarily mentally ill. Maybe he's off his rocker. I wouldn't climb up that tree, but you know, that's just me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You got the legs for it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Got the -- no, not anymore. But here's the problem, the problem is that we are left to live with those who are dangerous to us and to the community.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: As a judge, my power always stems from the ability to take someone out of society who I thought was a danger to himself or others. It's called the 730 in New York. Then you can send in the Bellevue and then they can sit there for a while and be analyzed. But the bottom line here is the left is lying to us that's why this is happening. When Lori Lightfoot comes out and she says there is no crime here and it's up to the people who own the stores. You're full of crap. The people who own the stores pay taxes and you're defunding the police. You're telling the police to stand down. It's you, Lori Lightfoot. And I'm sick and tired of people talking about the fact that you know what, we've got to worry about these people. No, I want to worry about the innocent victims. And Larry Krasner ought to be beaten out of Philadelphia, booted out of Philadelphia I should say and recall along with Gascon. They are literally killing us and injuring us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How do you feel about all this, Dana?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: I mean, I will concur with everything. I am baffled by the effort to downplay the rising rate of crime and murder across the country by the federal government, by the administration. I understand that the press secretary today said, well, actually, the DOJ is helping a little bit. Like I just think that's pretty weak sauce compare to what people are seeing. When you had one of the police officers today, when the stats came out about the 12 cities, he said that it was up in Rochester. That this is like a war zone. People are actually seeing this with their own eyes and I think we need a surge to deal with it. I think that a lot of this money that they want to spend in Build Back Better should be put into our prison system, into the court system. If the courts are backed up or the prisons are backed up where you don't have enough prison guards, you don't have enough police, that' where I would put all of that money, maybe not all, okay. But I would put a great majority of it there because if people do not feel safe, they're -- people are not going to vote for you if you tell them, you're fine, you're fine. No, don't worry. This is -- murder capital, don't worry about it. War zone, it's not real. That's what Larry Krasner did in Philadelphia.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: People are not going to vote for them. People are going to vote for people who say I'll keep you safe. And who's saying that right now?

utterances.speaker: JESSICA TARLOV, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I am saying it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're conservative now that you're pregnant.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Yes, for one more week.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did you read "The New York Times" headline, though, about this trade tree? They said it just caught on fire?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It just caught on fire.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Well, that SUV also just plowed through a Christmas parade.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. Well, yes, you're really coming around.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I just read a lot and it was in "The New York Times" so, as it was in my bible. So, Eric Adams is saying I'm going to keep safe. And there are some mayors across the country and specifically the police chief, so I think, are leading this surge of making it clear to people and even higher positions of power that what's going on on the ground is not adequate. They don't have the support that they need. They don't have enough police officers who have stayed in their jobs or who want to answer these calls because they know that things are not going to turn out as well for them as they did before and we can debate how we got to this place. But I think it relates to the conversation from last week about when we're going to see the fissures between the D.A.' and the council members and the police officer, the police chief and now the administration. And I do believe that Joe Biden gets this. This is how he talked on the campaign trail. He was the first one to come out about the looting and to say this is different than the George Floyd protest. This is ransacking stores and just taking what you want. So, I'm hopeful that we will shift more on that direction. And as always, because this is on film, that is why this is happening. Like this is why people are going to jail who would might normally be able to get away with it and it's what's going on with these stores because you can't say they're not being looted because it's all on film.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but who's going to jail?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Like Derek Chauvin -- I'm saying that we've had a lot of --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, with murders, yes. But he violent crime that affects all of us.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I'm just saying that the phenomenon of being able to record everything is making a substance difference in people's ability to ignore - -

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. It's not about 20 years. Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Well, from the reporting, the guy that lit the tree on fire is probably going to get out today or tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He's going to make bail. Arson --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because it's not a felony arson for what he did apparently.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, it's an offense under New York law where he has to be bailed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Forget about whether or not he is tied to the community. The guy is homeless. He has no ties.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So how does he do bail if he doesn't have any money?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You don't need money anymore.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, you don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can walk out the door?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's why they have this bail reform.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No cash bail.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No cash bail.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's a euphemism.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Hopefully, they take away his lighter.

utterances.speaker: GURFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Coming up, Joe Biden now ordering the corrupt liberal media to save his presidency.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: President Biden now trying to pressure the media into giving him better coverage. The White House is not happy with how the press has been talking about inflation and the supply crisis. So a group of senior officials are reportedly holding secret meetings with major outlets and are trying to convince them into or coerce them I should say, into more positive coverage. And it looks like "The View" got the message loud and clear.

utterances.speaker: WHOOPI GOLDBERG, HOST OF THE VIEW
utterances.utterance: The question is why don't people want to hear the good news for a change, you know? Is that what we need to hear when something good is happening here?

utterances.speaker: JOY BEHAR, HOST OF THE VIEW
utterances.utterance: You said, you know, that people are not picking up on the good stuff. I believe that that's because the media is not portraying him as a winner. They are minimizing what he is doing. When the chips are down, Americans are going to understand that if Republicans take control of this country again, we are done as a country. We are done! Believe it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And they actually applaud. What do you say, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's an enlightened crowd.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Though you might want to go on that --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. For the next book, yes, we might have to do "The View." Do you realize how bad things must be for a Democrat president to be begging Democrats in the media for a better spin?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Haven't they done enough, judge? I mean, they spiked the laptop. They ignored the border. They cheerlead all of his mandates. They write stories like why inflation is actually a good thing.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, like, what else could they do? It's like me telling Johnny like, Johnny, you have to do more. You're really not doing enough. Like, what else could johnny do? Breastfeed Jesse, Jr.? Honestly. I mean, if he could I'd ask for it. But the thing that's going on here is this, Biden has some nerve to ask the press. He hasn't talked to the press. He turns around like he's deaf every time he's finished talking.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's fair. That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's done two sit down interviews since May. Last time I checked its December. What does he do? He clowns around to the town hall with Lemon or Cooper the whole time. He hasn't even sat down with the AP, Reuters, "Washington Post," "New York Times," "Wall Street Journal." And then he complains about bad coverage? He's not selling his agenda because he's a poor communicator. And so --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. Dana?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- his team is going to all the journalist and saying "can you be a little bit more like Jen Psaki?" Try to be a little bit more like Jen. And if he had good results, those results would sell themselves. If he was reducing crime, inflation, illegal immigration, COVID cases, he'd get better coverage.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But the point is they are saying -- they are saying he is not communicating properly. Is he not communicating properly or is Jesse right that he has limited the number of interviews and is continuing his campaign bunker strategy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I actually imagine that if I were those report -- those newsrooms that got one of these visits, I would say, excuse me? Because we haven't heard from him. We haven't even talked to him. Like we can ask Jen Psaki questions, she's the press secretary. She's very available and she answers all the questions. We might not like the answers but that's what they are. He doesn't do -- he's not selling it. And they -- I read these headlines, Biden's communicators are to blame. No, they are not. And also they miss opportunities all the time. It comes from the top. For example, the other day they could have had a great press conference that said, guess what, omicron not as lethal as we thought.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That was great. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, this is great news. And in fact, guess what, you're not going to have to wear a mask on a plane. Something like that. Like they could make decisions based on science, actually. That would help them. But this is the same White House that demanded better coverage for the amazing airlift they did out of Afghanistan. It was like people were falling off the planes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is the White House that said that Republicans were the ones who wanted to defund the police. They had to backtrack on that. They said that inflation wasn't happening. Then they said, well, it's just transitory, when people are basically seeing in their own lives, but also in the statistics that come out. So, I got to hand it to them, like to go in, like they know that they have a problem so that they're going to go in. I don't think that it's going to change "The View" saying we should all be happy and celebrate the wins. It's not going to change the fact that when you're at the grocery store and you see somebody in front of you that basically is like counting up the items and having to put away the Rice Krispies treat ingredients. And I heard this from a Democrat on the "Against the Grain Podcast.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Like that stuff is real.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, it is real, but Greg, what about the allegation that the press is underselling the good news? What is the good news?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's hilarious. I mean, this reminds me of a guy going to another guy and pleading with them to talk him up in front of a girl he likes, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who hasn't done that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, exactly. I do that, you know, when I talked to the CEO at Fox about Jesse. Jesse's really coming along. But you got to be in total, I mean, think about it when "The View" becomes your public relations arm.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, I guess the cast from "Teen Mom" was busy because I mean, this is -- I mean, it's amazing how almost like robotic that was. But I love also how this is posed as a secret meeting behind the scenes as if --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- it acknowledges the fact that the Biden White House is indeed a facade like a storefront from an episode of "Gunsmoke" and you just, right behind -- that's just fake.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's all this other stuff going on and they don't know what the hell is going on. I just long for the good old days when Trump would just - - Trump didn't do -- Trump would talk to anybody and everybody. You know exactly what he was thinking. And he, of course, he did call. The only people he called in the news were commentariats, right? He never like went to the heart. They didn't call up anybody. He didn't call up Bret Baier. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You'd be surprised. I think he called everybody.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I think he called everyone including Maggie Haberman.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But everything he said on the phone he would say on T.V.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Joe doesn't talk to anybody except for himself when he's muttering in the yard.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right, Jessica. Now, think about it. The White House has three other senior officials trying to talk to the press. And the one that I thought was most interesting to persuade the press to give better coverage was the ports envoy. Yes, I guess he's going to tell him the supply chain problem is isn't as bad as we think it is.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Well, ports are top of mind for people.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Because --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So what's the good news?

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Well, the good news actually, I thought this was interesting. Today, Joe Manchin put out this -- he carries around a card of the administration's accomplishments. Joe Manchin who I find to be relentlessly negative actually in terms of Democratic causes, actually walked around with this and talks about the COVID Relief Act, talks of the bipartisan Infrastructure Act.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: People need money and they like money and Republicans love money more than Democrats do so that should be a good thing. But --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, no. This money is going, well, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: They clearly know there is a problem and there were two things today that struck my interest on this front. One, Joe Manchin carries around this card, and two, the Monmouth Poll that showed that inflation and kitchen table issues are top of mind for basically every voter no matter your partisan affiliation. And that's what they are having to run against. And having a ports envoy have this conversation or people who aren't Joe Biden who I think does actually pretty well in these interviews, is not going to hack it for the American public. And so that needs to switch around before the midterms come around. And people want to see their president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We need an envoy. Let me see this.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Ahead, Democrats are now turning fast on Biden's vaccine mandates.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Democrats beginning to sour on President Biden's vaccine mandates. Senator Joe Manchin now coming out against them and prominent liberals like Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer is upset that with the impact they've had on private businesses and the workforce. So, Dana, I'm going to go to you on this. It's obviously a big turn on the tide here. What do you think the Biden administration is going to do?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, just like -- let's go back to August in Afghanistan for just a moment. And I believe it was middle of the month now, Afghanistan has been going downhill for two weeks and we're watching all of this happen. And all of a sudden, there's a press conference as announced by President Biden. Oh, what's it -- talk about Afghanistan? All right, pay attention. No. That's when he announced all these vaccine mandates to try to change the subject. And I think that he completely miscalculated. I understand wanting to get people vaccinated, absolutely. And I support vaccines for the people that it make sense for health-wise. But Rand Paul did something pretty interesting through the Small Business Committee showing like -- showing how the job impact in different states is the result of these vaccine mandates. So, if when you look at it that way, you have the president saying "well, we're going to do these mandates." Well, the Republicans are going to say something and it was going to be job impact. So, in some ways, this decision in the middle of Afghanistan to just throw out there the vaccine mandate without good legal backing was the most costly P.R. stunt in history because now it's going to be pulled back.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: Judge, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I think the judge who made the decision on pulling back all of the mandates was absolutely right, whether it's for companies with over 100 people, whether it's for the health care providers and now for the contractors, the federal contractors. Then I think -- and I'm going to read this. Even in times of crisis, courts must preserve the rule of law and ensure that all branches of government act within the bounds of their constitutionally grounded authority. Biden didn't do it that's why he keeps getting slapped down. And I -- one more thing, why is the left so focused on totalitarianism? They have such an instinct to lock us down, shut us down, and shut us up. That's all.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: We're tight on time so I'm just going to say, Jesse, but I disagree with all (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, yes. Not one, not two but all three of his vax mandates got rocked by the court. I remember someone sat right there in a mustache and they told me these vax mandates were perfectly legal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I remember hearing a lot about that. And now Biden's delayed his own federal government vax mandates until after Christmas. So he's going to fire you after the holidays instead of before the holidays, which is great. We were said, you know, you're vaxxed if you have your two shots. Now you're vaxxed if you have a booster. Now you have to get your five-year-old vaxxed. You're going to have to get your dog vaccine. Look, he's going to get the Pfizer by the way. And you don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Give him what the best.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- you can't have flex -- you have to have flexibility. You have to have some sort of religious exemption, medical exemption or else it feels too heavy-handed. And at this point, Joe blames all of his problems on COVID and he's just trying to vax his way out. And he can't do it because you're never going to get 100 percent vaccination rate in this country. So, he just has to get that through his head.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: If he can.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I got really nervous that Jesse thought I had a moustache, by the way, for a second there. Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you want a mustache, Jessica, you can have a mustache. This is 2021.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I don't. I don't want it. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay. Well, anyway, this is a dream come true for communists, right. The ever present -- ever present variant lets the government into your life more and more and to control it. And whenever one goes away, they can pop up another one. And suddenly, they like the police because the police have no control over what they decide. So the police has to end up enforcing these rules. And it can only go in dark places, Mayor Driftwood Easer Island face. This is my question to you. He's pushing -- he's pushing mandates as he leaves the office -- as he leaves office. In five days, the mandate -- the mandates come in and then he leaves. My question to you is what is he trying to gain out of this? This -- is there something here financially that De Blasio has like a connection with pharmacy -- pharmaceutical companies? Because I don't --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that he wants to be governor of New York and he needs to win a primary, so he's trying to get to the left of the current governor Kathy Hochul, and that this was the way to do it on his way out. That's what I think.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I think he also doesn't like Eric Adams, so he wants him to have to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a political financial move in my mind. By the way, just one last thing, I don't understand why people don't understand that you can be vaxxed and against vax mandates.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm double vaxxed, I'm going to get a booster, I'm against vax mandates. People go like, you're vaxxed? And then they go, oh you're against -- like, you -- people live in this polarizing universe. They got to stop.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: All right, ahead, a verdict at any moment in the Jussie Smollett trial. The latest details coming up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We can get a verdict at any moment in the trial for hate crime hoaxer Jussie Smollett. The jury deliberating right now after both sides made their closing arguments. The defense calling the case against Smollett a house of cards and saying the Osundairo brothers --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Osundairo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Osundairo brothers are certified liars. But the prosecution reminding the jury there's a mountain of evidence against the actor. All right, Judge, predictions?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Not guilty -- I mean, guilty, guilty. And I'll tell you why. Look, the idea -- and I lived in Chicago for three years when I had a syndicated show. But the idea that you're going to meet up with these guys, one of whom you had a relationship with in a bathhouse, at 2:00 in the morning on a cold night in Chicago -- when you go out to buy eggs and when the stores close, you decide to have a sandwich, what happened to your diet that you said you needed eggs on? And then you text message the Osundairo brothers at the same time kind of giving them your location. And I mean, all of it -- none of it makes sense. He's going to be found guilty. He's going to get probation because it's not a big offense. But he's going to get his butt sued for the amount of time the police spent trying to solve this crime.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. I think -- Jessica, it's not -- you know, you saw the media just completely support him upfront. And people say, oh, how gullible. I -- my belief is that the media was susceptible to the hoax because we've been inundated with this concept that America is hopelessly racist and that actual MAGA white guys are out on the street. I mean, to believe that, you have to have that somehow bolstered. You have to be programmed to believe that.

utterances.speaker: TARLOV
utterances.utterance: I think that's true to a great extent. And hopefully, that'll come over and affect politicians too from just don't speak out right away about it. Say, you know, if these allegations are true, it's a terrible crime, we're going to investigate this. The celebrity factor is so important here. It's what motivated Jussie Smollett to do this in the first place and also made it a national news story because I think if it hadn't been him, it would have been something they would have dealt with on a small scale and just been -- this is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like, the hate --- there's a lot of hate crime hoaxes, Jessie. What do you make of this? Do you think the media will own up to their idiocy or just --

The rest of the media looks at a headline like that and they're like, breaking news, atop a confederate statue, shooting flaming crosses at transgender immigrant rights ralliers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
